channel.title: Posts on VRcollab
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on VRcollab

item.title: BIM Integrations, Colour Markups & VDC Coordination — VRcollab v0.9.10
item.description: New BIM & Format Import Integrations Added: Revit 2019 , Navisworks 18, Archicad 22 (Beta), Direct OBJ Import Supported as of v0.9.10: Revit(2014–2019), Sketchup(2016–2018), Archicad(21–22), Rhino3D 6, Navisworks 18, OBJ Formats Merge Feature: For eg. Archicad and Revit Models merged in VRcollab, with ability to access full data from both softwares for purposes of BIM VR coordination. 3D scan Point Cloud Data OBJ VRcollab Import Direct OBJ imports allow for 3D scanned terrain or building to be imported into VRcollab for merging with any of the above integrated formats.

item.title: Best Office Setups for Virtual Design Construction (VDC) Coordination
item.description: With the growing adoption of BIM (Building Information Modelling) in the last decade, construction methodologies have seen an evolution towards lean construction and integrated project delivery. This entails the need for collaborative software, digitalisation of information, along with new organisational space approaches that are in tune to the Virtual Design Construction (VDC) framework. #1: Co-located BIG Room As construction projects grow increasingly more complex, in both scale and technical specifications.

item.title: VRcollab STUDIO 2.0: Are CAVEs replacing coordination rooms in Architecture and Construction?
item.description: Building design coordination has traditionally been done in both meeting and board rooms, usually in front of a large screen while stakeholder’s perspective are dictated by a single pilot. Navigating BIM software to the best possible perspective in order to coordinate both clashes and design. This tedious process is further complicated by another two professionals whose role is to capture the projected screen and annotate important considerations. All this is then finally consolidated for further interrogation and remodelling.
